poem:
The Traitorous Play  

In halls of echoes, whispers speak,  
The table round, where trust is weak.  
Screens flicker tales of loyal woes,  
As shadows dance in scripted throes.  
A warning murmurs through the air,  
In games of hearts, where few play fair.  
In royal walls, where truths are spun,  
Faithful tremble, as masks come undone.
